intro: Stickmannia saundersii, commonly known as the mountain stickman, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Stickmannia saundersii is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
